frontmatter.title: Open Source Contribution for beginners
frontmatter.description: Open-source software is a software that contains source code (code in general like HTML,CSS, js, python, etc) which is publicly available or accessible for people to read, change, improve/enhance and share.

frontmatter.title: Git and Github for beginners
frontmatter.description: Git is a distributed version-control system for tracking changes in source code during software development.It is designed for coordinating work among programmers, but it can be used to track changes in any set of files.

frontmatter.title: Tailwind CSS Resources you wish you had.
frontmatter.description: Tailwind CSS is an amazing CSS framework that everyone should learn.  Let me list a few resources that I found helpful as I was learning. I hope you will add them to your list or keep using them if you have already.

frontmatter.title: React questions to help you learn
frontmatter.description: Useful React questions to ask yourself as you learn. Get to know the basic questions used in interviews to help you land that job.

frontmatter.title: The vanilla Javascript basics to know before learning React JS
frontmatter.description: In the process of learning React JS, I have found a few things you should understand before starting it. I will brush through the features and add useful links to the documentation you can use to learn them on a deep level.
